meanings.definition: a person or thing that obliterates
meanings.sent1: The superhero was known as the obliterator in the city.
meanings.sent2: The army used powerful obliterator machines to demolish the old building.
meanings.sent3: The little robot toy pretended to be an obliterator, destroying imaginary enemies.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an obliterator, wiping away all sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The storm acted as a fierce obliterator, erasing all traces of the picnic.

meanings.definition: a device used to obliterate something
meanings.sent1: The office had a high-tech obliterator for shredding confidential documents.
meanings.sent2: The teacher handed out small obliterator tools for erasing mistakes on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The magical wand was like an obliterator, making objects disappear with a wave.
meanings.sent4: The sun acted as a natural obliterator, fading the colors of the old painting.
meanings.sent5: The snow blower was a powerful obliterator, clearing the driveway in minutes.

meanings.sent1: The volcano erupted and obliterated the entire village in seconds.
meanings.sent2: The evil villain's plan was to obliterate all evidence of his crimes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to obliterate the garden by digging up all the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The loud music seemed to obliterate all other sounds in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The powerful hurricane threatened to obliterate the small coastal town.
